NEWSEEK Poland, published by Ringier Axel Springer Poland has appointed Tomasz Lis, 46, as new editor-in chief. He succeeds Wojciech Maziarski, 52, who is leaving the company. Tomas Lis has worked as editor-in-chief for the Polish weekly Wprost over the last two years.

Edyta Sadowska, CEO of Ringier Axel Springer Polska „ We are all looking forward to Tomasz Lis, who is such an experienced journalist and media manager. This appointment is another step towards our objective to become the leading weekly news magazine in Poland.”

Tomasz Lis is one of the most recognized Polish journalists. He began his career in 1990 in “Wiadomości”, the main news edition of public broadcasting corporation (TVP). From 1994 to 1997 he worked as TVP correspondent in Washington D.C. Between 1997 and 2004 he created and led “Fakty”, the main edition of news in Polish private television TVN, and later “Wydarzenia” in Polsat Television, where he also created program “What’s with Poland?” For the past two years he has worked as chief editor of Wprost weekly, and since 2008 he is author of “Tomasz Lis na żywo” program in TVP2 channel. He was awarded the title “Journalist of the Year” three times (1999, 2007 and 2009) and nine times received “Wiktor” award for TV personalities.

Tomasz Lis ( born March 6, 1966 in Zielona Góra ) is a Polish political journalist.

After graduation, he studied journalism at the University of Warsaw. While still a student of the fourth year of study, he won an open competition for TV journalists of state television. On 3 May 1990 he made ​​his debut as host of the evening journals. Soon he was promoted to first parliamentary reporter. In 1992, he studied at Loyola University in New Orleans. From 1994 to 1997 he was the rapporteur of the Polish state television in the United States.

Since 1997, he hosted the private TV station TVN, the news program " Fakty " (facts ). In the fall of 2003, he published the book " Co z Tá Polska? " ( What about go to Poland? ) Out with a circulation of over 100,000 copies. After the success of the book he was traded as a presidential candidate. In 2004 he was dismissed from TVN.

On 1 September 2005, he was a board member and program director of the private television station Polsat. With the journalist Hanna Smoktunowicz it led the news program " Wydarzenia " (events). For unknown reasons, he left Polsat on 20 September 2007. Shortly thereafter, in November 2007, he was engaged as advisor to the board of the magazine publisher Edipresse Polska.

Since 25 February 2008, he moderated in the second program of state television ( TVP 2) his program " Tomasz Lis na żywo " ( Tomasz Lis live). On 25 May 2010 he was also chief editor of the weekly news magazine Wprost. Every Friday he takes on the morning show in TOK FM radio part. In February 2012, he was discharged at Wprost and three weeks later was editor of the competing weekly Newsweek Polska.

For his varied work he received several major Polish media awards. Ten times the he was " Wiktor " award, including the " Super Wiktor " in 2006. During the years 1999, 2007 and 2009 he was awarded " Journalist of the Year " twice (2002 and 2005), he received the " telephoto camera ".

Family

In July 1994, Tomasz Lis married the journalist Kinga Rusin. They were divorced in June 2006. In October 2007, he married the TV presenter and colleague Hanna Smoktunowicz.

Tomasz Lis

Tomasz Lis began his career in 1990 in TVP (Polish Public Television) after winning an open competition for the post of a newsreader for TVP’s main evening news, the most widely watched in Poland ‘Wiadomości’. Between 1994 and 1997 he held the position of a senior correspondent for TVP in Washington, D.C. From 1997 to 2004 he worked for the TVN network, where he created and anchored the news broadcast FAKTY – second in viewership after TVP’s (Polish Public Television) ‘Wiadomości’. From 2006 to 2007 he was associated with Polsat Network, being a Member of Polsat’s Board of Directors. While at Polsathe was an author and host of Poland’s most watched political talk-show at the time ‘What’s with Poland?”. From 2008 till 2016 he anchored his own political talk-show TOMASZ LIS LIVE the most watched political show in Poland rating and viewership-wise.

His cooperation with TVP ended when representatives of Law and Justice Party took over public television in Poland and dismissed all independent journalists.

In February 2012, he founded ‘NaTemat’, a news website, featuring columnists and various news sources. In March 2012 he became editor-in-chief of the current affairs weekly ‘Newsweek Polska’. He is also an author of non-fiction political books with “Co z tą Polską?” (What’s with Poland?) published in 2003 with which became a bestseller in Poland, selling over 100,000 copies.

During the past 17 years of his career he has interviewed a number of key figures in world politics. Among them are Bill Clinton, George Bush Sr., George W. Bush, Michail Gorbachev, Dmitri Medvedev, Tony Blair, Gordon Brown, Yitzhak Rabin, Benjamin Netanyahu, Hillary Clinton, Condoleezza Rice and Colin Powell.

Tomasz was awarded nine ‘Wikotor’s’ the equivalent of the American Emmy Awards. Awarded, as he only journalist in Poland, “Journalist of the Year’ prize by PRESS magazine in 1999, 2007 and 2009.

Tomasz Lis was selected for the the 2017 European Press Prize shortlist with his columns for Newsweek Polska
